tweet_text:
The vaccine, called ZyCoV-D, was approved on August 20 and is delivered via a jet injector, sometimes called a gene gun.
It uses a high-pressure stream of fluid to blast it into the cells of the skin.

tweet_text:
@WhitChrissy @BOBBYMUNK1 @GenuineBenny India has already approved a DNA vaccine against COVID-19, ZyCov-D, the world's first plasmid DNA vaccine for human use. It is set to roll out October first week onwards.

An mRNA jab has also been developed within the country by Pune-based Genova. Phase II trials are underway.
text_en: India has already approved a DNA vaccine against COVID-19, ZyCov-D, the world's first plasmid DNA vaccine for human use. It is set to roll out October first week onwards.An mRNA jab has also been developed within the country by Pune-based Genova. Phase II trials are underway.

@ApocalypticFor1 @S_Evangelina And don't forget that there are other vaccines as well.
Inactivated: Sinopharm, SinoVac (both China).
Vector (adenovirus carrier): AstraZeneca, JJ, Sputnik.
mRNA: BioNTech-Pfizer, Moderna.
Protein-based: Novavax.
DNA-based: ZyCoV-D (developed in India).
text_en: And don't forget that there are other vaccines as well.Inactivated: Sinopharm, SinoVac (both China).Vector (adenovirus carrier): AstraZeneca, JJ, Sputnik.mRNA: BioNTech-Pfizer, Moderna.Protein-based: Novavax.DNA-based: ZyCoV-D (developed in India).

tweet_text: @Allikat685 @benedictecallan There is a DNA vaccine approved for COVID-19 use in India called ZyCoV-D. Ref: https://t.co/xY1e0GZfth.  It doesn't integrate with host DNA because it is much larger than the host nucleus plasmids.  You might be surprised that most adenovirus vaccines also use DNA plasmids
text_en: There is a DNA vaccine approved for COVID-19 use in India called ZyCoV-D. Ref: . It doesn't integrate with host DNA because it is much larger than the host nucleus plasmids. You might be surprised that most adenovirus vaccines also use DNA plasmids
